events.event: In-Q-Tel founded by CIA Director George Tenet and Ruth David
Initial portfolio investments in data analytics and geospatial intelligence companies
Investment in Keyhole Inc. (geospatial visualization) - later acquired by Google, became Google Earth
Early investor in Palantir Technologies (Peter Thiel's intelligence data analytics company)
Post-9/11 expansion - increased funding for counterterrorism technologies
Investments in big data analytics, cloud computing, mobile technologies
Partnership withFireEye for cybersecurity (advanced persistent threat detection)
Snowden revelations increase public awareness of IC-tech company relationships
AI/machine learning investment focus - computer vision, natural language processing
Biotechnology investments - synthetic biology, biometric identification, health monitoring
Portfolio expansion to 300+ companies across all intelligence-relevant technology sectors
